intro: Verbascum halacsyanum, commonly known as the Hungarian mullein, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its tall, hairy stems and large, velvety leaves. The plant produces showy, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or arid environments. Verbascum halacsyanum is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
